Hi

Could I please take advice on an issue following an MOT failure?

I have an intermittent issue with the headlights on my bus. I have a two position dash mounted dimmable headlight switch. My van is 12v ( I believe from standard ). If I pull the dashboard switch fully into the second position, I am sometimes unable to get dipped beam. When this occurs, only the sidelights are illuminated. At this point I also cannot get full beam to stay on ( full beam works if I keep the steering column stalk pulled as if I am flashing the lights ). If I continue to pull the stalk until such time that main beam stays on, I am then able to get dipped beam successfully from this position again by pulling the steering column lever normally

I am wondering if it is likely to be a sticking relay rather than a faulty switch?

I would appreciate any thoughts as I am a novice at anything electrical!

Kind Regards
Paul

Hi Paul,

More than likely a dirty switch.

They are very basic inside and easily repairable with some emery cloth and contact cleaner.

Just drill out the two rivets holding the cover over the switch.

Far better to use an original than a repro.

Nick
